intro: Galium asperrimum, commonly known as rough bedstraw, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its fruits are small, dry capsules that contain several seeds. Galium asperrimum is often found in disturbed soils, along roadsides, and in woodland edges.
